content.newText:
def fibonacci(n):
    """Generates the Fibonacci sequence up to n terms."""
    a, b = 0, 1
    for _ in range(n):
        yield a
        a, b = b, a + b

if __name__ == "__main__":
    facts = [
        "Each number is the sum of the two preceding ones.",
        "The ratio of successive numbers approaches the Golden Ratio (approx 1.618).",
        "November 23rd is Fibonacci Day (11/23).",
        "Any positive integer can be represented as a sum of non-consecutive Fibonacci numbers.",
        "The only Fibonacci numbers that are perfect powers are 1, 8, and 144.",
        "The sequence appears in nature, such as in the branching of trees and the arrangement of leaves on a stem.",
        "Many flowers have a Fibonacci number of petals.",
        "The sequence was known to Indian mathematicians as early as the 6th century.",
        "Fibonacci popularized the sequence in the Western world with a problem about rabbit populations.",
    ]
    for i, number in enumerate(fibonacci(10)):
        fact = facts[i % len(facts)]
        print(f"{number}: {fact}")

content.newText:
def fibonacci(n):
    """Generates the Fibonacci sequence up to n terms."""
    a, b = 0, 1
    for _ in range(n):
        yield a
        a, b = b, a + b

if __name__ == "__main__":
    facts = [
        "Each number is the sum of the two preceding ones.",
        "The ratio of successive numbers approaches the Golden Ratio (approx 1.618).",
        "November 23rd is Fibonacci Day (11/23).",
        "Any positive integer can be represented as a sum of non-consecutive Fibonacci numbers.",
        "The only Fibonacci numbers that are perfect powers are 1, 8, and 144.",
        "The sequence appears in nature, such as in the branching of trees and the arrangement of leaves on a stem.",
        "Many flowers have a Fibonacci number of petals.",
        "The sequence was known to Indian mathematicians as early as the 6th century.",
        "Fibonacci popularized the sequence in the Western world with a problem about rabbit populations.",
    ]
    for i, number in enumerate(fibonacci(10)):
        fact = facts[i % len(facts)]
        print(f"{number}: {fact}")
